name: The Last Few Episodes--Part 1 Quiz | 'Six Feet Under' - Seasons and Episodes | 15 Questions

questions.text: Why doesn't Nate's memorial service include a viewing?
questions.correct: He did not want to be embalmed.
options: He is an organ donor.
His family members are too distraught.
He requested cremation.
questions.explanation:
He did not want to be embalmed.

	Nate has a "green" funeral. He is not embalmed and he has no casket. He is buried in a cloth shroud in a beautiful wilderness area. His late wife Lisa Kimmel Fisher would have approved.

questions.text: After Nate's death, David keeps "seeing" an evil man in a hooded red sweatshirt. Ultimately, who does the man turn out to be?
options: Keith
David's mother, Ruth
David's dad, Nathaniel
questions.explanation:
part of David himself.

	After David embraces the man (who turns out to have David's own terrified face), he begins to recover from his intense grief and paranoid fear.

questions.text: Whom does Claire marry (in the future as it's shown at the end of the final episode)?
options: Billy Chenowith (Brenda's brother)
Russell, a fellow art student
Arthur, a former intern at Fisher and Diaz
questions.explanation:
Ted, Claire's former co-worker.

	Claire probably begins to fall in love with Ted on the night of Nate's seizure, when Ted spends all night with her in the hospital. He's a Republican (so he and she have opposite political viewpoints), but he's very supportive of Claire's artistic career.

questions.text: In Brenda's mind, how does (the late) Nate feel about their baby, Willa?
questions.correct: He taunts Brenda by saying their child is defective.
options: He assures Brenda that their premature baby will be just fine.
He says he can't wait until Willa can join him in the afterlife.
He tells Brenda that he loves Willa far more than Maya.
questions.explanation:
He taunts Brenda by saying their child is defective.

	After Ruth comforts Brenda, the new mom (and struggling step-mom) seems to experience a catharthis. She has a new fantasy in which Nate (and his dad) appear next to Willa's crib. Nate finally cradles the baby and assures Brenda that he will love Willa forever. It seems that Brenda's previous fantasies stemmed from her grief, anger, and self-hatred triggered by Nate's infidelity and cool, detached rejection just prior to his death.

questions.text: Where is Ruth living at the end of the final episode?
questions.correct: at her sister's home in Topanga Canyon
options: with Brenda, Maya, and Willa
in her old home at the Fisher family's funeral home
with George in his apartment
questions.explanation:
at her sister's home in Topanga Canyon.

	When Ruth is horribly depressed she agrees to go and live with George, but as her grief lifts a bit she realizes that she can't do this. Her sister Sarah is away, but Ruth goes to stay at Sarah's home with their friend Bettina. By the end of the series, Ruth has begun to dress differently--she looks like a lovely, beautifully-dressed aging hippie (not unlike Sarah).

questions.text: What comforting information does Maggie give Ruth following Nate's death?
questions.correct: that Nate was happy just before his seizure
options: that Nate was planning to start marriage counseling with Brenda
that Nate and Maggie were planning to marry and have a baby
that Nate loved his mother very much
questions.explanation:
that Nate was happy just before his seizure.

	After Nate's death, Maggie tells her father off for deserting her when she was a child. Then she leaves L.A. for parts unknown.

questions.text: How does Aunt Sarah behave at Nate's memorial service and burial?
questions.correct: She is strong, compassionate, and helpful.
options: She falls apart emotionally and flees.
She is high on drugs and alcohol the entire time.
She picks fights with Ruth and David.
questions.explanation:
She is strong, compassionate, and helpful.

	Sarah really comes through for the family, even though she is grief-stricken herself. She supports her sister, and reads a beautiful poem from the Mystic Odes of Rumi at Nate's graveside.

questions.text: Why does Rico decide to start his own business after Nate dies?
options: David falls apart and is no longer a responsible partner.
Vanessa urges Rico to buy a mortuary that is on the market.
Rico has always wanted to make his own business decisions.
questions.explanation:
for all of these reasons.

	Vanessa is as excited about the new business as Rico is.

questions.text: Who helps Ruth to care for Maya during the period when Brenda gives up the little girl?
options: Bettina
Sarah
Claire
questions.explanation:
George.

	Typically, George steps right into the role of caretaker. He even joins an Internet news group on childcare.

questions.text: Why does Brenda ask Billy to move out?
options: He behaves inappropriately with Claire's boyfriend.
He tries to kiss her again.
He behaves inappropriately with Maya.
questions.explanation:
She has an incest dream.

	And a very creepy dream it is. I was so relieved to discover that it WAS a dream!

questions.text: How does Keith cope with David's pathological grief and paranoia following Nate's death?
questions.correct: He asks David to move out until he recovers.
options: He has David committed to a mental hospital.
He asks their adopted sons to spend more time with David.
He nurses David at home until David recovers.
questions.explanation:
He asks David to move out until he recovers.

	Keith is afraid that David's odd behavior will harm Anthony and Durrell, so he asks David to leave their home temporarily. This turns out to be the right decision. David rests and recuperates at his mom's house. Eventually he faces his "demons" and recovers.

questions.text: How does Bettina help Ruth cope with Nate's death?
questions.correct: by encouraging her to take drugs
options: by holding a seance during which Nate speaks to his mother
by praying with her and Father Jack
by convincing Brenda to let Maya live with Ruth
questions.explanation:
by encouraging her to take drugs.

	Ironically, Bettina, the friend who bullied Ruth's sister Sarah through detox, encourages Ruth to take pill after pill after pill. When Ruth worries about addiction, Bettina jokingly offers to help Ruth through detox if necessary. I love Kathy Bates as Bettina. Academy Award winner Bates directed many of the "SFU" episodes, too.

questions.text: What surprising behavior does Olivier display?
questions.correct: He is very loving with little Willa.
options: He makes a pass at Brenda.
He breaks up with Margaret.
He refuses to recommend Claire for a job.
questions.explanation:
He is very loving with little Willa.

	Olivier not only comes through for Margaret on the day of Nate's memorial service, he recommends Claire for a prestigious photography job and helps care for little Willa.

questions.text: Who comes to take Maya away from Ruth and back to Brenda?
options: Olivier
George
Billy
questions.explanation:
Margaret.

	Margaret is fairly nasty to poor Ruth--no surprise--but perhaps Margaret is defending her daughter.

questions.text: By the end of the final episode, with whom is Maya living?
options: with Ruth
with David and Keith
with Margaret
questions.explanation:
with Brenda.

	As far as Maya knows, Brenda is her mother, so it is probably best that she ends up with Brenda. It seems clear that Grandmas Margaret and Ruth and Uncles Billy, David, and Keith will help with Maya's and Willa's upbringing.
